bill_title: analyze and promote economic development for South Dakota's Native American population and to establish a task force.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to analyze and promote economic development for South Dakota's Native American population, to establish certain related loan and grant programs, to establish a task force, and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The state-tribal economic development partnership program is hereby established. Any tribal government associated with any Indian reservation located wholly or partially in South Dakota may choose to participate in the program. Under the program, the participating tribe may receive grant funding from the economic development partnership fund established in § 1-16G-51 in accordance with the provisions of §§ 1-16G-51 to 1-16G-53, inclusive. Grant funding may be used for the following purposes: (1) Provide financial assistance to the tribe to be used in establishing and implementing a joint sovereign uniform commercial code (UCC) filing system agreement with the South Dakota secretary of state under which the secretary of state will provide UCC filing services for liens on personal property collateral that are created under the tribe's secured transactions act or similar arrangement; (2) Provide financial assistance to the tribe to be used in establishing and implementing zoning laws and ordinances; (3) Provide grant funding sufficient for the employment of a full-time economic development director for the tribe. Section 2. That § 1-16G-51 be amended to read as follows: 1-16G-51. There is hereby created in the state treasury the economic development partnership fund. The Board of Economic Development may award grants to any nonprofit development corporation, tribal government, municipality, county, or other political subdivision of this state from the fund on a matching basis as provided in §§ 1-16G-52 and 1-16G-53. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited into the fund. Any money in the economic development partnership fund is continuously appropriated. Any money deposited into and distributed from the fund shall be set forth in an informational budget as described in § 4-7-7.2. Section 3. The Governor's Office of Economic Development shall administer the tribal economic development loan program, which is hereby created, to provide funding for the creation or development of new businesses or the expansion of existing businesses, owned or operated by private persons or entities or tribal governments, that impact economic conditions and resources on Indian reservations or in counties or municipalities that had Native American populations of at least five percent in the most recent federal decennial census. Preference shall be given to individuals who are enrolled members of an Indian tribe and entities whose governing bodies consist of a majority of enrolled tribal members. The loan program shall take into account the unique financial and legal needs and requirements associated with business development in reservation areas and communities. The Board of Economic Development shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify the application process and timelines, guidelines and criteria for approval of applications, interest rates, distribution of funds, repayment procedures, and other procedures and requirements necessary for the implementation of the loan program. Section 4. There is hereby created in the state treasury the tribal economic development program fund. The Governor's Office of Economic Development may award loans for the purposes and under the terms provided in section 3 of this Act from the fund. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited into the fund. Any money in the tribal economic development fund shall be appropriated through the normal budget process. Section 5. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the tribal economic development fund to be used for the purposes specified in section 3 of this Act. Section 6. The commissioner of the Governor's Office of Economic Development shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 7. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2015, shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8. Section 8. There is hereby established the South Dakota Tribal Economic Development Task Force. The task force consists of the following members: (1) For each of the nine Indian tribes located in South Dakota that chooses to participate in the task force, the chairman or president of the tribe or a person designated by the tribal chairman or tribal president to represent the participating tribe; (2) The director of the Office of Tribal Government Relations; (3) Two current or former members of the House of Representatives who have served as members of the State-Tribal Relations Committee to be appointed by the speaker of the House of Representatives; (4) Two current or former members of the Senate who have served as members of the State-Tribal Relations Committee to be appointed by the president pro tempore of the Senate; and (5) Five persons appointed by the Governor. If a vacancy on the task force occurs, the vacancy shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Section 9. The task force shall be under the supervision of the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council and staffed and funded as an interim legislative committee. The Legislative Research Council may receive additional funds from any legal source to carry out the purposes of this Act. The executive board shall designate the chair and the vice chair of the task force. Section 10. The task force shall evaluate issues associated with economic development needs, initiatives, and barriers affecting South Dakota's Native American population and South Dakota's Indian tribes and tribal governments. Specifically, the task force shall analyze business and economic sectors and segments having potential for higher levels of success, as well as other possible approaches to improve economic conditions. The task force shall also address workforce availability, including education and skills, related demographics, salary and wage scales, and other issues affecting human resources necessary for the promotion of economic development for this segment of South Dakota's population. Section 11. The task force shall begin its activities in 2014 and shall submit an interim report to the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council not later than December 1, 2014, and a final report, recommendations, and potential draft legislation to the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council no later than December 1, 2015.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to analyze and promote economic development for South Dakota's Native American population and to establish a task force. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 1-16G-50 be amended to read as follows: 1-16G-50. There is hereby created in the state treasury the local infrastructure improvement grant fund. The Board of Economic Development may award grants to any political subdivision of this state, tribal government, or local development corporation from the fund to construct or reconstruct infrastructure for the purpose of serving an economic development project. The board shall consult state agencies to evaluate the feasibility and merits of the proposed infrastructure improvements. The board shall consider the funding mechanisms available to and utilized by the applicant when making a decision to award a grant. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited into the fund. Any money in the local infrastructure improvement grant fund is continuously appropriated. Any money deposited into and distributed from the fund shall be set forth in an informational budget as described in § 4-7-7.2. Section 2. That § 1-16G-51 be amended to read as follows: 1-16G-51. There is hereby created in the state treasury the economic development partnership fund. The Board of Economic Development may award grants to any nonprofit development corporation, tribal government, municipality, county, or other political subdivision of this state from the fund on a matching basis as provided in §§ 1-16G-52 and 1-16G-53. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited into the fund. Any money in the economic development partnership fund is continuously appropriated. Any money deposited into and distributed from the fund shall be set forth in an informational budget as described in § 4-7-7.2. Section 3. There is hereby established the South Dakota Tribal Economic Development Task Force. The task force consists of the following members: (1) For each of the nine Indian tribes located in South Dakota that chooses to participate in the task force, the chairman or president of the tribe or a person designated by the tribal chairman or tribal president to represent the participating tribe; (2) The secretary of the Department of Tribal Relations; (3) Two current or former members of the House of Representatives who have served as members of the State-Tribal Relations Committee to be appointed by the speaker of the House of Representatives; (4) Two current or former members of the Senate who have served as members of the State-Tribal Relations Committee to be appointed by the president pro tempore of the Senate; and (5) Five persons appointed by the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council. If a vacancy on the task force occurs, the vacancy shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Section 4. The task force shall be under the supervision of the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council and staffed and funded as an interim legislative committee. The Legislative Research Council may receive additional funds from any legal source to carry out the purposes of this Act. The executive board shall designate the chair and the vice chair of the task force. Section 5. The task force shall evaluate issues associated with economic development needs, initiatives, and barriers affecting South Dakota's Native American population and South Dakota's Indian tribes and tribal governments. Specifically, the task force shall analyze business and economic sectors and segments having potential for higher levels of success, as well as other possible approaches to improve economic conditions. The task force shall also address workforce availability, including education and skills, related demographics, salary and wage scales, and other issues affecting human resources necessary for the promotion of economic development for this segment of South Dakota's population. Section 6. The task force shall begin its activities in 2014 and shall submit an interim report to the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council not later than December 1, 2014, and a final report, recommendations, and potential draft legislation to the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council no later than December 1, 2015.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to analyze and promote economic development for South Dakota's Native American population and to establish a task force. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 1-16G-50 be amended to read as follows: 1-16G-50. There is hereby created in the state treasury the local infrastructure improvement grant fund. The Board of Economic Development may award grants to any political subdivision of this state, tribal government, or local development corporation from the fund to construct or reconstruct infrastructure for the purpose of serving an economic development project. The board shall consult state agencies to evaluate the feasibility and merits of the proposed infrastructure improvements. The board shall consider the funding mechanisms available to and utilized by the applicant when making a decision to award a grant. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited into the fund. Any money in the local infrastructure improvement grant fund is continuously appropriated. Any money deposited into and distributed from the fund shall be set forth in an informational budget as described in § 4-7-7.2. Section 2. That § 1-16G-51 be amended to read as follows: 1-16G-51. There is hereby created in the state treasury the economic development partnership fund. The Board of Economic Development may award grants to any nonprofit development corporation, tribal government, municipality, county, or other political subdivision of this state from the fund on a matching basis as provided in §§ 1-16G-52 and 1-16G-53. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited into the fund. Any money in the economic development partnership fund is continuously appropriated. Any money deposited into and distributed from the fund shall be set forth in an informational budget as described in § 4-7-7.2. Section 3. There is hereby established the South Dakota Tribal Economic Development Task Force. The task force consists of the following members: (1) For each of the nine Indian tribes located in South Dakota that chooses to participate in the task force, the chairman or president of the tribe or a person designated by the tribal chairman or tribal president to represent the participating tribe; (2) The secretary of the Department of Tribal Relations; (3) Two current or former members of the House of Representatives who have served as members of the State-Tribal Relations Committee to be appointed by the speaker of the House of Representatives; (4) Two current or former members of the Senate who have served as members of the State-Tribal Relations Committee to be appointed by the president pro tempore of the Senate; and (5) Five persons appointed by the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council. If a vacancy on the task force occurs, the vacancy shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Section 4. The task force shall be under the supervision of the Office of the Governor and staffed as determined by the Governor. The Governor shall designate the chair and the vice chair of the task force. Section 5. The task force shall evaluate issues associated with economic development needs, initiatives, and barriers affecting South Dakota's Native American population and South Dakota's Indian tribes and tribal governments. Specifically, the task force shall analyze business and economic sectors and segments having potential for higher levels of success, as well as other possible approaches to improve economic conditions. The task force shall also address workforce availability, including education and skills, related demographics, salary and wage scales, and other issues affecting human resources necessary for the promotion of economic development for this segment of South Dakota's population. Section 6. The task force shall begin its activities in 2014 and shall submit an interim report to the Governor and the Legislature not later than December 1, 2014, and a final report, recommendations, and potential draft legislation to the Governor and the Legislature no later than December 1, 2015.
